POST /accounts/{account_id}/workers/obse.description: Runs a temporary or saved query

chart.description: Whether to include timeseties data in the response

compare.description: Whether to include comparison data with previous time periods

dry.description: Whether to perform a dry run without saving the results of the query. Useful for validation

granularity.description: Time granularity for aggregating results (in milliseconds). Controls the bucketing of time-series data

ignoreSeries.description: Whether to ignore time-series data in the results and return only aggregated values

limit.description: Maximum number of events to return.

offset.description: Cursor for pagination to retrieve the next set of results

offsetBy.description: Number of events to skip for pagination. Used in conjunction with offset

parameters.description: Optional parameters to pass to the query execution

calculations.description: Create Calculations to compute as part of the query.

datasets.description: Set the Datasets to query. Leave it empty to query all the datasets.

filterCombination.description: Set a Flag to describe how to combine the filters on the query.

filters.description: Configure the Filters to apply to the query.

groupBys.description: Define how to group the results of the query.

havings.description: Configure the Having clauses that filter on calculations in the query result.

limit.description: Set a limit on the number of results / records returned by the query

needle.description: Define an expression to search using full-text search.

orderBy.description: Configure the order of the results returned by the query.

order.description: Set the order of the results

value.description: Configure which Calculation to order the results by.

patternType.description: Type of pattern to search for when using pattern-based views

queryId.description: Unique identifier for the query to execute

timeframe.description: Time range for the query execution

from.description: Start timestamp for the query timeframe (Unix timestamp in milliseconds)

to.description: End timestamp for the query timeframe (Unix timestamp in milliseconds)

view.description: View type for presenting the query results.

requestBody.description: Query your observability events, requests, and traces. Build visualizations and identify insights.

items.description: The data structure of a telemetry event

$containers.description: Cloudflare Containers event information enriches your logs so you can easily identify and debug issues.

$workers.description: Cloudflare Workers event information enriches your logs so you can easily identify and debug issues.

datasets.description: Set the Datasets to query. Leave it empty to query all the datasets.

filterCombination.description: Set a Flag to describe how to combine the filters on the query.

filters.description: Configure the Filters to apply to the query.

groupBys.description: Define how to group the results of the query.

havings.description: Configure the Having clauses that filter on calculations in the query result.

limit.description: Set a limit on the number of results / records returned by the query

needle.description: Define an expression to search using full-text search.

orderBy.description: Configure the order of the results returned by the query.

abr_level.description: The level of Adaptive Bit Rate (ABR) sampling used for the query. If empty the ABR level is 1

bytes_read.description: Number of uncompressed bytes read from the table.

elapsed.description: Time in seconds for the query to run.

rows_read.description: Number of rows scanned from the table.

timeframe.description: Time range for the query execution

from.description: Start timestamp for the query timeframe (Unix timestamp in milliseconds)

to.description: End timestamp for the query timeframe (Unix timestamp in milliseconds)

statistics.description: The statistics object contains information about query performance from the database, it does not include any network latency

abr_level.description: The level of Adaptive Bit Rate (ABR) sampling used for the query. If empty the ABR level is 1

bytes_read.description: Number of uncompressed bytes read from the table.

elapsed.description: Time in seconds for the query to run.

rows_read.description: Number of rows scanned from the table.
